description: System-generated unique identifier for this claim record tied to an asset/incident.
System timestamp when the record was created or last updated; used for audit and ordering.
Flag indicating whether the operator/organization was at fault for the incident.
Date of the incident or claim in YYYYMMDD format; likely the occurrence date; confirm with SME.
Short narrative summarizing the incident circumstances.
Free-text description of the involved asset (e.g., vehicle details); likely optional; confirm with SME.
Narrative of damage identified and repair actions taken or planned.
Total monetary amount associated with repairs or the claim for this incident.
Secondary meter reading at time of incident (e.g., engine hours or auxiliary odometer); likely seldom used; confirm with SME.
Primary odometer/meter reading of the asset at the time of incident.
Identifier of the external repair or service provider associated with the claim.
Reference type or target entity for the vendor ID (e.g., table/namespace); confirm with SME.
Identifier of the driver or operator associated with the incident.
Reference type for the driver ID (e.g., employee entity); confirm with SME.
Identifier of the equipment or vehicle involved in the incident.
Reference type for the equipment ID (e.g., equipment entity/table); confirm with SME.
Identifier of the related accident or incident record.
Reference type for the accident ID (e.g., target entity/table); confirm with SME.
Primary key from the source legacy system for cross-reference.
Source table name from the legacy system for this record.
Identifier or code for a related service request initiated by the incident; confirm with SME.
Additional meter reading field; purpose varies (e.g., attachment or hour meters); confirm with SME.
Additional meter reading field; purpose varies (e.g., attachment or hour meters); confirm with SME.
Flag indicating whether a repair work order was created or linked for this incident.
Flag indicating whether a maintenance request was created or linked due to this incident.
